P.text: This part describes the policies for servicing direct FLP loans, except for borrowers who are delinquent, financially distressed, or otherwise in default on their loan.
Servicing actions described in this part include:
Limited resource reviews;
Graduation to commercial credit;
Application of payments;
Maintaining and disposing of security;
Transfer of security and assumption of debt; and
Servicing accounts of deceased borrowers.
The Agency services direct FLP loans under the policies contained in this part. This part is not applicable to Non-program loans, except where noted.

contents.SUBJECT: Abbreviations and definitions.
contents.P:
Abbreviations and definitions for terms used in this part are provided in
§
761.2
of this chapter
.

P.text:
A borrower with limited resource interest rate loans is required to provide the Agency annually the operation's financial information to determine if the borrower can afford to pay a higher interest rate on the loan. The Agency will review the information provided in accordance with
§
761.105
of this chapter
.
If the borrower's farm operating plan shows that the debt service margin exceeds 110 percent, the Agency will increase the interest rate on the loans with a limited resource interest rate until:
A further increase in the interest rate results in a debt service margin of less than 110 percent; or
The interest rate is equal to the interest rate currently in effect for the type of loan.
Except as provided in paragraph (d) of this section, the Agency will increase the limited resource interest rate to the current interest rate for the type of loan, if the borrower:
Purchases items not planned during the term of the loan;
Refuses to submit information the Agency requests for use in reviewing the borrower's financial condition;

Ceases farming, as described in
§
765.253
; or

Is ineligible due to disqualification resulting from Federal crop insurance violation according to
7 CFR part
718
.
If the borrower has limited resource interest rate loans that are deferred, the Agency will not change the interest rate during the deferral period.

section.head: Borrower graduation requirements.
section.citation:
[
72 FR 63309
, Nov. 8, 2007, as amended at
75 FR 54016
, Sept. 3, 2010]

contents.SUBJECT: Borrower graduation requirements.

P.text: In accordance with the promissory note and security instruments, the borrower must graduate to another source of credit if the Agency determines that:
The borrower has the ability to obtain credit from other sources; and
Adequate credit is available from other sources at reasonable rates and terms.
The Agency may require partial or full graduation.
In a partial graduation, all FLP loans of one type (i.e. all chattel loans or all real estate loans) must be paid in full by refinancing with other credit with or without an Agency guarantee.
In a full graduation, all FLP loans are paid in full by refinancing with other credit with or without an Agency guarantee.
A loan made for chattel and real estate purposes will be categorized according to how the majority of the loan's funds are expended.
The borrower must submit all information that the Agency requests in conjunction with the review of the borrower's financial condition.

The Agency may provide a borrower's prospectus to lenders in an attempt to identify sources of non-Agency credit and assess the lenders' interest in refinancing the borrower's loan. The Agency will notify the borrower when the borrower's prospectus is provided to one or more lenders.
If a lender expresses an interest in refinancing the borrower's FLP loan, the borrower must:
Apply for a loan from the interested lender within 30 days of notice; or

Seek guaranteed loan assistance under the market placement program in accordance with
§
762.110(g)
of this chapter
.
The borrower will be responsible for any application fees or purchase of stock in conjunction with graduation.
CLs are not subject to graduation requirements under this part.

contents.CITA:
[
72 FR 63309
, Nov. 8, 2007, as amended at
75 FR 54016
, Sept. 3, 2010]

contents.SUBJECT: Borrower noncompliance with graduation requirements.
contents.P:
Borrower failure to fulfill all graduation requirements within the time-period specified by the Agency constitutes default on the loan. The Agency will accelerate the borrower's loan without offering servicing options provided in
7 CFR part
766
.

section.head: Transfer and assignment of Agency liens.

contents.SUBJECT: Transfer and assignment of Agency liens.
contents.P: The Agency may assign its lien to the new lender when the borrower is graduating and all FLP debt will be paid in full.

P.text: Borrowers must submit their loan payments in a form acceptable to the Agency, such as checks, cash, and money orders. Forms of payment not acceptable to the Agency include, but are not limited to, foreign currency, foreign checks, and sight drafts.
The Agency credits the borrower's account as of the date the Agency receives payment.

section.head: Types of payments.
section.citation:
[
72 FR 63309
, Nov. 8, 2007, as amended at
75 FR 54016
, Sept. 3, 2010]

contents.SUBJECT: Types of payments.

P.text: Regular payments are derived from, but are not limited to:
The sale of normal income security;
The sale of farm products;
Lease income, including mineral lease signing bonus;
Program or disaster-related disbursements from USDA or crop insurance entities; and
Non-farm income.
Extra payments are derived from any of the following:
Sale of chattel security other than normal income security;
Sale of real estate security;
Refinancing of FLP debt;
Cash proceeds of insurance claims received on Agency security, if not being used to repair or replace the security;
Any transaction that results in a loss in the value of any Agency basic security;
Refunds of duplicate program benefits or assistance to be applied on CL or EM loans; or
Refunds of unused loan funds.

npcatch.head: Payments from sale of real estate.

P.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, payments derived from the sale of real estate security will be treated as regular payments at the Agency's discretion, if the FLP loans will be adequately secured after the transaction.

contents.CITA:
[
72 FR 63309
, Nov. 8, 2007, as amended at
75 FR 54016
, Sept. 3, 2010]

P.text: A regular payment is credited to a scheduled installment on program and non-program loans. Regular payments are applied to loans in the following order:
Annual operating loan;
Delinquent FLP installments, paying least secured loans first;
Non-delinquent FLP installments due in the current production cycle in order of security priority, paying least secured loans first;
Any future installments due.

An extra payment is not credited to a scheduled installment and does not relieve the borrower's responsibility to make scheduled loan installments, but will reduce the borrower's FLP indebtedness. Extra payments are applied to FLP loans in order of lien priority except for refunds of unused loan funds, which shall be applied to the loan for which the funds were advanced.

contents.SUBJECT: Distribution of payments.
contents.P: The Agency applies both regular and extra payments to each loan in the following order, as applicable:

P.text: Recoverable costs and protective advances plus interest;
Deferred non-capitalized interest;
Accrued deferred interest;
Interest accrued to date of payment; and
Loan principal.

Unless the Agency has reservations regarding the validity of the payment, the Agency may release the borrower's security instruments at the time payment is made, if the borrower makes a final payment by one of the following methods:
Cash;
U.S. Treasury check;
Cashier's check; or
Certified check.
Security instruments will only be released when all loans secured by the instruments have been paid in full or otherwise satisfied.
The Agency will return the paid note and satisfied security instruments to the borrower after the Agency processes the final payment and determines that the total indebtedness is paid in full.
If the borrower refunds the entire loan after the loan is closed, the borrower must pay interest from the date of the note to the date the Agency received the funds.

If an Agency miscalculation of a final payment results in an overpayment by the borrower of less than $10, the borrower must request a refund from the Agency in writing. Overpayments of $10 or more automatically will be refunded by the Agency.

If an Agency miscalculation of a final payment amount results in an underpayment, the Agency may collect all account balances resulting from its error. If the Agency cannot collect an underpayment from the borrower, the Agency will attempt to settle the debt in accordance with subpart B of
7 CFR part
1956
.

contents.SUBJECT: General policy.
contents.P: All Agency servicing actions regarding preservation and protection of Agency security will be consistent with the covenants and agreements contained in all loan agreements and security instruments.

P.text: Comply with all provisions of the loan agreements;

Non-compliance with the provisions of loan agreements and documents, other than failure to meet scheduled loan repayment installments contained in the promissory note, constitutes non-monetary default on FLP loans by the borrower;
Maintain, protect, and account for all security;
Pay the following, unless State law requires the Agency to pay:
Fees for executing, filing or recording financing statements, continuation statements or other security instruments; and
The cost of lien search reports;
Pay taxes on property securing FLP loans when they become due;
Maintain insurance coverage in an amount specified by the Agency;
Protect the interests of the Agency when a third party brings suit or takes other action that could affect Agency security.

contents.SUBJECT: Protective advances.
contents.P: When necessary to protect the Agency's security interest, costs incurred for the following actions will be charged to the borrower's account:

P.text: Maintain abandoned security property;
Preserve inadequately maintained security;
Pay real estate taxes and assessments;
Pay property, hazard, or flood insurance;
Pay harvesting costs;
Maintain Agency security instruments;
Pay ground rents;
Pay expenses for emergency measures to protect the Agency's collateral; and
Protect the Agency from actions by third parties.

The Agency participates and complies with central filing systems in States where CFS has been organized. In a State with a CFS, the Agency is not required to additionally notify potential purchasers that the Agency has a lien on a borrower's chattel security, unless specifically required by State law.

In a State without CFS, the Agency follows the filing requirements specified for perfecting a lien on a borrower's chattel security under State law. The Agency will distribute the list of chattel and crop borrowers to sale barns, warehouses, and other businesses that buy or sell chattels or crops. In addition, the Agency may provide the list of borrowers to potential purchasers upon request.

section.head: Subordination of liens.
section.citation:
[
72 FR 63309
, Nov. 8, 2007, as amended at
75 FR 54016
, Sept. 3, 2010]

contents.SUBJECT: Subordination of liens.

P.text: The borrower must submit the following, unless it already exists in the Agency's file and is still current as determined by the Agency:
Completed Agency application for subordination form;
A current financial statement, including, in the case of an entity, financial statements from all entity members;

Documentation of compliance with the Agency's environmental regulations contained in subpart G of
7 CFR part
1940
;
Verification of all non-farm income;
The farm's operating plan, including a projected cash flow budget reflecting production, income, expenses, and debt repayment plan; and
Verification of all debts.
For loans secured by real estate, the Agency will approve a request for subordination if all of the following conditions are met:
The borrower is not in default or will not be in default on FLP loans by the time the subordination closing is complete;
The loan will be used for an authorized loan purpose or is made in conjunction with a guaranteed loan;
The credit is essential to the farming operation, and the borrower cannot obtain the credit without a subordination;
The borrower is not able to graduate on any program except for CL;

If the borrower is an entity and the Agency has taken real estate as additional security on property owned by a member, a subordination for any authorized loan purpose may be approved when it is needed for the entity member to finance a separate farming operation, provided the subordination does not cause the unpaid principal and interest on the FLP loans to exceed the value of loan security or otherwise adversely affect the security;

The borrower must not be ineligible as a result of a conviction for controlled substances according to
7 CFR part
718 of this chapter
;

The borrower must not be ineligible due to disqualification resulting from Federal crop insurance violation according to
7 CFR part
718 of this chapter
;

The borrower will not use loan funds in a way that will contribute to erosion of highly erodible land or conversion of wetlands as described in subpart G of
7 CFR part
1940
;
There is no other subordination outstanding with another lender in connection with the same security;

In the case of real property purchase or exchange, the Agency will obtain a valid mortgage and the required lien position on the real property. The Agency will require title clearance and loan closing for the property in accordance with
§
764.402
of this chapter
;

Any planned development of real estate security will be performed as directed by the creditor, approved by the Agency, and will comply with the terms and conditions of
§
761.10
of this chapter
;
Subordinations of SAA mortgages may only be approved when there is no increase in the debt which is prior to the SAA debt; and

If a borrower has only a Non-program loan, the Agency does not permit subordination. The Agency may subordinate Non-program security when it is also security for a program loan with the same borrower in accordance with this section.
For loans secured by chattel, the subordination must meet the conditions contained in paragraphs (b)(1) through (12) of this section.
The Agency will approve a request for a second subordination to enable a borrower to obtain crop insurance, if the following conditions are met:

The creditor to whom the first subordination was given did not provide for payment of the current year's crop insurance premium, and consents in writing to the provisions of the second subordination to pay insurance premiums from the crop or insurance proceeds;
The borrower assigns the insurance proceeds to the Agency or names the Agency in the loss payable clause of the policy; and
The subordination meets the conditions under paragraphs (b)(1) through (12) of this section.

An appraisal of the property that secures the FLP loan will be required when the Agency determines it necessary to protect its interest. Appraisals will be obtained in accordance with
§
761.7
of this chapter
.

contents.CITA:
[
72 FR 63309
, Nov. 8, 2007, as amended at
75 FR 54016
, Sept. 3, 2010]

section.head: Junior liens.
section.citation:
[
72 FR 63309
, Nov. 8, 2007, as amended at
75 FR 54016
, Sept. 3, 2010]

contents.SUBJECT: Junior liens.

P.text: The borrower will not give a lien on Agency security without the consent of the Agency. Failure to obtain Agency consent will be considered by the Agency when making eligibility determinations for future requests for assistance and may adversely impact such requests.
The Agency will consent to the terms of a junior lien if all of the following conditions are met:
The borrower's ability to make scheduled loan payments is not jeopardized;
The total debt against the security does not exceed the security's market value;
The junior lienholder agrees in writing not to foreclose the security instrument unless written notice is provided to the Agency;
The borrower is unable to graduate on any program except for CL; and
The junior lien will not otherwise adversely impact the Agency's financial interests.

contents.CITA:
[
72 FR 63309
, Nov. 8, 2007, as amended at
75 FR 54016
, Sept. 3, 2010]

section.head: Conditions for severance agreements.
section.citation:
[
72 FR 63309
, Nov. 8, 2007, as amended at
75 FR 54016
, Sept. 3, 2010]

contents.SUBJECT: Conditions for severance agreements.
contents.P: For loans secured by real estate, a borrower may request Agency consent to a severance agreement or similar instrument so that future chattel acquired by the borrower will not become part of the real estate securing the FLP debt. The Agency will consent to severance agreements if all of the following conditions are met:

P.text: The financing arrangements are in the financial interest of the Agency and the borrower;
The transaction will not adversely affect the Agency's security position;
The borrower is unable to graduate on any program except for CL;
The transaction will not jeopardize the borrower's ability to pay all outstanding debts to the Agency and other creditors; and
The property acquired is consistent with authorized loan purposes.

contents.CITA:
[
72 FR 63309
, Nov. 8, 2007, as amended at
75 FR 54016
, Sept. 3, 2010]

P.text: A borrower is required to be the operator of Agency security in accordance with loan purposes, loan agreements, and security instruments.
A borrower who fails to operate the security without Agency consent is in violation of loan agreements and security instruments.

The Agency will consider a borrower's request to lease or cease to operate the security as provided in
§§
765.252
and
765.253
.
The borrower may lease real estate security provided the following conditions are met:
The Agency approves the borrower's request;
The term of consecutive leases does not exceed 3 years, or 5 years if the borrower and the lessee are related by blood or marriage;
The lease does not contain an option to purchase; and

The requirements of
§
765.253
have been met.
The borrower must request Agency consent to lease any mineral rights used as security for FLP loans.
For loans secured by real estate before December 23, 1985, the Agency has a security interest in any mineral rights the borrower has on the real estate pledged as collateral.
For loans secured by real estate on or after December 23, 1985, the Agency has a security interest in any mineral rights if the mineral rights were included in an appraisal.
The Agency may consent to a mineral lease if the proposed use of the leased rights will not adversely affect either:
The Agency's security interest; or

Compliance with any applicable environmental requirements of subpart G of
7 CFR part
1940
.
Lease of chattel security is not authorized.

Lease proceeds are considered normal income security and may be used in accordance with
§
765.303
.
The Agency will not approve any crop allotment lease that will adversely affect its security interest in the allotment.
The borrower must assign all rental proceeds from an allotment lease to the Agency.

section.head: Ceasing to operate security.
section.citation:
[
72 FR 63309
, Nov. 8, 2007, as amended at
75 FR 54016
, Sept. 3, 2010]

contents.SUBJECT: Ceasing to operate security.
contents.P: If the borrower requests Agency consent to cease operating the security or if the Agency discovers that the borrower is failing to operate the security, the Agency will give consent if:

P.text: Such action is in the Agency's best interests;
The borrower is unable to graduate on any program except for CL;

The borrower is not ineligible as a result of disqualification for Federal crop insurance violation according to
7 CFR part
718
;

The borrower has leased the security according to
§
765.252(a)(2)
; and
Any one of the following conditions is met:

The borrower is involved in the day-to-day operational activities, management decisions, costs and returns of the farming operation, and will continue to reside in the immediate farming community for reasonable management and operation involvement;

The borrower's failure to operate the security is due to age or poor health, and the borrower continues to reside in the immediate farming community for reasonable management and operation involvement; or
The borrower's failure to operate the security is beyond the borrower's control, and the borrower will resume the farming operation within 3 years.

contents.CITA:
[
72 FR 63309
, Nov. 8, 2007, as amended at
75 FR 54016
, Sept. 3, 2010]

P.text: The borrower must account for all security.

The borrower may not dispose of chattel security for an amount less than its market value. All proceeds, including any amount in excess of the market value, must be distributed to lienholders for application to the borrower's account in the order of lien priority.
The Agency considers the market value of normal income security to be the prevailing market price of the commodity in the area in which the farm is located.

The market value for basic security is determined by an appraisal obtained in accordance with
§
761.7
of this chapter
.
When the borrower sells chattel security, the property and proceeds remain subject to the Agency lien until the lien is released by the Agency.
The Agency and all other lienholders must provide written consent before a borrower may use proceeds for a purpose other than payment of lienholders in the order of lien priority.
The transaction must not interfere with the borrower's farming operation or jeopardize the borrower's ability to repay the FLP loan.
The disposition must enhance the program objectives of the FLP loan.

When the borrower exchanges security property for other property or purchases new property with sale proceeds, the acquisition must be essential to the farming operation as well as meet the program objectives, purposes, and limitations for the type of loan.

All checks, drafts, or money orders which the borrower receives from the sale of Agency security must be payable to the borrower and the Agency. If all FLP loan installments and any past due installments, for the period of the agreement for the use of proceeds have been paid, however, these payments from the sale of normal income security may be payable solely to the borrower.

section.head: Use and maintenance of the agreement for the use of proceeds.

contents.SUBJECT: Use and maintenance of the agreement for the use of proceeds.

P.text: The borrower and the Agency will execute an agreement for the use of proceeds for each production cycle, including proceeds from the sale of milk, crops on hand or in storage, planned proceeds from Government payments, crop insurance and insurance proceeds derived from the loss of security.

The agreement for the use of proceeds will remain in effect until the proper disposition of all listed chattel security has been accomplished, or the remaining chattel security has been transferred to a new agreement for the use of proceeds.
The borrower must report any disposition of basic or normal income security immediately to the Agency.

If a borrower wants to dispose of chattel security not listed or in a way different than provided on the agreement for the use of proceeds, the borrower must obtain the Agency's consent before the disposition.

If the borrower sells security to a purchaser not listed in the agreement for the use of proceeds, the borrower must immediately notify the Agency of what property has been sold and of the name and business address of the purchaser.

The borrower must provide the Agency with the necessary information to update the farm operating plan and the agreement for the use of proceeds in accordance with
§
761.102
of this chapter
.
Changes to the agreement on the use of proceeds will be recorded, dated and initialed by the borrower and the Agency.

The borrower must maintain records of dispositions of chattel security and the actual use of proceeds. The borrower must make these records available to the Agency at the end of the period covered by the agreement for the use of proceeds.

section.head: Use of proceeds from chattel security.

contents.SUBJECT: Use of proceeds from chattel security.

P.text: Proceeds from the sale of basic security and normal income security must be remitted to lienholders in order of lien priority.
Proceeds remitted to the Agency may be used as follows:
Applied to the FLP loan;
Pay customary costs appropriate to the transaction.

With the concurrence of all lienholders, proceeds may be used to preserve the security because of a natural disaster or other severe catastrophe, when funds cannot be obtained by other means in time to prevent the borrower and the Agency from suffering a substantial loss.
Security may be consumed as follows:
Livestock may be used by the borrower's family for subsistence;

If crops serve as security and usually would be marketed, the Agency may allow such crops to be fed to the borrower's livestock, if this is preferable to marketing, provided the Agency obtains a lien or assignment on the livestock, and livestock products, at least equal to the lien on the crops.

npcatch.head: Proceeds from the sale of normal income security.

P.text: In addition to the uses specified in paragraph (a) of this section, the agreement for the use of proceeds will allow for release of proceeds from the sale of normal income security to be used to pay essential family living and farm operating expenses. Such releases will be terminated when an account is accelerated.

npcatch.head: Proceeds from the sale of basic security.

P.text: In addition to the uses specified in paragraph (a) of this section:
Proceeds from the sale of basic security may not be used for any family living and farm operating expenses.

Security may be exchanged for chattel property better suited to the borrower's needs if the Agency will acquire a lien on the new property at least equal in value to the lien held on the property exchanged.

Proceeds may be used to purchase chattel property better suited to the
borrower's needs if the Agency will acquire a lien on the purchased property. The value of the purchased property, together with any proceeds applied to the FLP loan, must at least equal the value of the Agency lien on the old security.
If a borrower disposes of chattel security without Agency approval, or misuses proceeds, the borrower must:
Make restitution to the Agency within 30 days of Agency notification; or
Provide disposition or use information to enable the Agency to consider post-approval within 30 days of Agency notification.

Failure to cure the first unauthorized disposition in accordance with paragraph (a) of this section, or a second unauthorized disposition, whether or not cured, constitutes a non-monetary default, will be considered by the Agency when making eligibility determinations for future requests for assistance, may adversely impact such requests, and may result in civil or criminal action.

When Agency security is sold, exchanged, or consumed in accordance with the agreement for the use of proceeds, the Agency will release its security interest to the extent of the value of the security disposed.
Security interests on wool and mohair may be released when the security is marketed by consignment, provided all of the following conditions are met:

The borrower assigns to the Agency the proceeds of the sale of the wool or mohair, less any remaining costs in shipping, handling, processing, and marketing, and less the amount of any advance (including any interest which may have accrued on the advance) made by the broker against the wool or mohair; and
The borrower and broker agree that the net proceeds of any advances on, or sale of, the wool or mohair will be paid by checks made payable jointly to the borrower and the Agency.

section.head: Requirements to obtain Agency consent.
section.citation:
[
72 FR 63309
, Nov. 8, 2007, as amended at
75 FR 54016
, Sept. 3, 2010]

contents.SUBJECT: Requirements to obtain Agency consent.
contents.P: The borrower must obtain prior consent from the Agency for any transactions affecting the real estate security, including, but not limited to, sale or exchange of security, a right-of-way across security, and a partial release. The Agency may consent to such transactions provided the conditions in this section are met.

P.text: The following conditions apply to all transactions affecting real estate:
The transaction will enhance the objectives for which the FLP loan or loans were made;
The amount received for the security being disposed of or the rights being granted is not less than the market value;
Any proceeds in excess of the market value are remitted to lienholders in the order of lien priority;
The transaction must not interfere with the borrower's farming operation;

The market value of the remaining security is adequate to secure the FLP loans, or if the market value of the security before the transaction was inadequate to fully secure the FLP loans, the Agency's equity in the security is not diminished;

The environmental requirements of subpart G of
7 CFR part
1940
must be met;
The borrower cannot graduate to other credit on any program except for CL;

The borrower must not be ineligible due to disqualification resulting from Federal crop insurance violation according to
7 CFR part
718
; and
The disposition of real estate security for an outstanding ST loan will only be authorized if the transaction will result in full repayment of the loan.

npcatch.head: Sale of timber, gravel, oil, gas, coal, or other minerals.

P.text: Agency security instruments require that the borrower request and receive written consent from the Agency prior to certain transactions, including, but not limited to, cutting, removal, or lease of timber, gravel, oil, gas, coal, or other minerals, except small amounts used by the borrower for ordinary household purposes.
The sale of timber from real estate that secures an FLP loan will be considered a disposition of a portion of the security.

For loans secured by real estate before December 23, 1985, the Agency has a security interest in mineral products, gravel, oil, gas, coal, or other resources and the sale by unit or lump sum payment will be considered a disposition of security.

For loans secured by real estate on or after December 23, 1985, the Agency has a security interest in mineral products, gravel, oil, gas, coal, or other resources if the value of such products was included in an appraisal. When the Agency has a security interest, the sale of such products will be considered a disposition of a portion of the security.

Any compensation the borrower may receive for damages to the surface of the real estate security resulting from exploration for, or recovery of, minerals must be assigned to the Agency. Such proceeds will be used to repair the damage, and any remaining funds must be remitted to lienholders in the order of lien priority or, with all lienholders' consent, used for an authorized loan purpose.

When an exchange of security results in a balance owing to the borrower, the proceeds must be used in accordance with
§
765.352
.

Property acquired by the borrower must meet program objectives, purposes and limitations relating to the type of loan involved as well as applicable requirements for appraisal, title clearance and security.
A borrower may sell a portion of the security for not less than its market value under a contract for deed subject to the following:

Payments will not exceed 10 annual installments of principal plus interest or the remaining term of the FLP loan, whichever is less. The interest rate will be the current rate being charged on a regular FO loan plus 1 percent or the rate on the borrower's notes, whichever is greater. Payments may be in equal or unequal installments with a balloon final installment;
The Agency's security rights, including the right to foreclose on either the portion being sold or retained, will not be impaired;

Any subsequent payments must be assigned to the lienholders and remitted in order of lien priority, or with lienholder's approval, used in accordance with
§
765.352
;
All other requirements of this section are met.
The Agency will not approve any crop allotment lease that will adversely affect its security interest.
The sale of an allotment must comply with all conditions of this subpart.

The borrower may transfer crop allotments to another farm owned or controlled by the borrower. Such transfer will be treated as a lease under
§
765.252
.

contents.CITA:
[
72 FR 63309
, Nov. 8, 2007, as amended at
75 FR 54016
, Sept. 3, 2010]

P.text: Proceeds from transactions affecting the real estate security may only be used as follows:
Applied on liens in order of priority;
To pay customary costs appropriate to the transaction, which meet the following conditions:
Are reasonable in amount;
Cannot be paid by the borrower;
Will not be paid by the purchaser;
Must be paid to consummate the transaction; and
May include postage and insurance when it is necessary for the Agency to present the promissory note to the recorder to obtain a release of a portion of the real estate from the mortgage.
For development or enlargement of real estate owned by the borrower as follows:

Development or enlargement must be necessary to improve the borrower's debt repayment ability, place the borrower's farming operation on a sound basis, or otherwise enhance the objectives of the loan;
Such use will not conflict with the loan purposes, restrictions or requirements of the type of loan involved;

Funds will be deposited in a supervised bank account in accordance with subpart B of
part
761 of this chapter
;
The Agency has, or will obtain, a lien on the real estate developed or enlarged;

Construction and development will be completed in accordance with
§
761.10
of this chapter
.

After acceleration, the Agency may approve transactions only when all the proceeds will be applied to the liens against the security in the order of their priority, after deducting customary costs appropriate to the transaction. Such approval will not cancel or delay liquidation, unless all loan defaults are otherwise cured.
The Agency will obtain an appraisal of the security proposed for disposition.
The Agency may waive the appraisal requirement when the estimated value is less than $25,000.
The Agency will obtain an appraisal of the remaining security if it determines that the transaction will reduce the value of the remaining security.

Appraisals, when required, will be conducted in accordance with
§
761.7
of this chapter
.

section.head: Conditions for transfer of real estate and chattel security.

contents.SUBJECT: Conditions for transfer of real estate and chattel security.

P.text: Approval of a security transfer and corresponding loan assumption obligates a new borrower to repay an existing FLP debt.

All transferees will become personally liable for the debt and assume the full responsibilities and obligations of the debt transferred when the transfer and assumption is complete. If the transferee is an entity, the entity and each member must assume personal liability for the loan.
A transfer and assumption will only be approved if the Agency determines it is in the Agency's financial interest.
A borrower must request and obtain written Agency consent prior to selling or transferring security to another party.

section.head: Transfer of security and loan assumption on same rates and terms.

contents.SUBJECT: Transfer of security and loan assumption on same rates and terms.
contents.P: An eligible applicant may assume an FLP loan on the same rates and terms as the original note if:

P.text: An individual with an ownership interest in the borrower entity buys the entire ownership interest of the other members and continues to operate the farm in accordance with loan requirements. The new owner must assume personal liability for the loan;
A new entity buys the borrower entity and continues to operate the farm in accordance with loan requirements; or

The original loan is an EM loan for physical or production losses and persons who were directly involved in the farm's operation at the time of the loss will assume the loan. If the original loan was made to:
An individual borrower, the transferee must be a family member of the original borrower or an entity that is comprised solely of family members of the original borrower.

A trust, partnership or joint operation, the transferee must have been a member, partner or joint operator when the Agency made the original loan or remain an entity comprised solely of people who were original members, partners or joint operators when the entity received the original loan.
A corporation, including limited liability company, or cooperative, the transferee must:

Have been a corporate stockholder or a cooperative member when the Agency made the original loan or will be an entity comprised solely of people who were corporate stockholders or cooperative members when the entity received the loan; and

Assume only the portion of the physical or production loss loan equal to the transferee's percentage of ownership. In the case of entity transferees, the transferee must assume that portion of the loan equal to the combined percentages of ownership of the individual stockholders or members in the transferee.

section.head: Transfer of security to and assumption of debt by eligible applicants.

contents.SUBJECT: Transfer of security to and assumption of debt by eligible applicants.

npcatch.head: Transfer of real estate and chattel security.

P.text: The Agency may approve transfers of security with assumption of FLP debt, other than EM loans for physical or production losses, by transferees eligible for the type of loan being assumed if:

The transferee meets all loan and security requirements in
part
764 of this chapter
for the type of loan being assumed; and

The outstanding loan balance (principal and interest) does not exceed the maximum loan limit for the type of loan as contained in
§
761.8
of this chapter
.

Applicants eligible for FO loans under
part
764 of this chapter
may assume Non-program loans made for real estate purposes if the Agency determines the property meets program requirements. In such case, the Agency will reclassify the Non-program loan as an FO loan.

npcatch.head: Loan types that the Agency no longer makes.

P.text:
Real estate loan types the Agency no longer makes (
i.e.
EE, RL, RHF) may be assumed and reclassified as FO loans if the transferee is eligible for an FO loan under
part
764 of this chapter
and the property proposed for transfer meets program requirements.
The transferee must assume the lesser of:
The outstanding balance of the transferor's loan; or
The market value of the security, less prior liens and authorized costs, if the outstanding loan balance exceeds the market value of the property.

The interest rate and loan term will be determined according to rates and terms established in
part
764 of this chapter
for the type of loan being assumed.

section.head: Transfer of security to and assumption of debt by ineligible applicants.

contents.SUBJECT: Transfer of security to and assumption of debt by ineligible applicants.

P.text: The Agency will allow the transfer of real estate and chattel security property to applicants who are ineligible for the type of loan being assumed only on Non-program loan rates and terms.
The Agency will reclassify the assumed loan as a Non-program loan.
Transferees must:
Provide written documentation verifying their credit worthiness and debt repayment ability;
Not have received debt forgiveness from the Agency;

Not be ineligible for loans as a result of a conviction for controlled substances according to
7 CFR part
718
; and

Not be ineligible due to disqualification resulting from Federal crop insurance violation according to
7 CFR part
718
.

The transferee must assume the total outstanding
FLP debt or if the value of the property is less than the entire amount of debt, an amount equal to the market value of the security less any prior liens. The total outstanding FLP debt will include any unpaid deferred interest that accrued on the loan to the extent that the debt does not exceed the security's market value.
Non-program transferees must make a downpayment to the Agency of not less than 10 percent of the lesser of the market value or unpaid debt.
The interest rate will be the Non-program interest rate in effect at the time of loan approval.
For a Non-program loan secured by real estate, the Agency schedules repayment in 25 years or less, based on the applicant's repayment ability.
For a Non-program loan secured by chattel property only, the Agency schedules repayment in 5 years or less, based on the applicant's repayment ability.

section.head: Payment of costs associated with transfers.

contents.SUBJECT: Payment of costs associated with transfers.
contents.P: The transferor and transferee are responsible for paying transfer costs such as real estate taxes, title examination, attorney's fees, surveys, and title insurance. When the transferor is unable to pay its portion of the transfer costs, the transferee, with Agency approval, may pay these costs provided:

P.text: The transferee's payoff of any junior liens does not exceed $5,000;
Fees are customary and reasonable;
The transferee can verify that personal funds are available to pay transferor and transferee fees; and
Any equity due the transferor is held in escrow by an Agency designated closing agent and is disbursed at closing.
Agency approval of an assumption does not automatically release the transferor from liability.
The Agency may release the transferor from liability when all of the security is transferred and the total outstanding debt is assumed.

If an outstanding debt balance will remain and only part of the transferor's Agency security is transferred, the written request for release of liability will not be approved, unless the deficiency is otherwise resolved to the Agency's satisfaction.

If an outstanding balance will remain and all of the transferor's security has been transferred, the transferor may pay the remaining balance or request debt settlement in accordance with subpart B of
7 CFR part
1956
.

Except for loans in default being serviced under
7 CFR part
766
, if an individual who is jointly liable for repayment of an FLP loan withdraws from the farming operation and conveys all of their interest in the security to the remaining borrower, the withdrawing party may be released from liability under the following conditions:
A divorce decree or property settlement states that the withdrawing party is no longer responsible for repaying the loan;
All of the withdrawing party's interests in the security are conveyed to the persons with whom the loan will be continued; and
The persons with whom the loan will be continued can demonstrate the ability to repay all of the existing and proposed debt obligations.

section.head: Continuation of FLP debt and transfer of security.

contents.SUBJECT: Continuation of FLP debt and transfer of security.

P.text: Following the death of a borrower, the Agency will continue the loan with any individual who is liable for the indebtedness provided that the individual complies with the obligations of the loan and security instruments.
The Agency will continue the loan with a person who is not liable for the indebtedness in accordance with subpart I of this part.
The Agency will continue the loan with a jointly liable borrower if the remaining borrower continues to pay the deceased borrower's loan in accordance with the loan and security instruments.

The Agency may continue the loan with an individual who inherits title to the property and is not liable for the indebtedness provided the individual makes payments as scheduled and fulfills all other responsibilities of the borrower according to the loan and security instruments.
A deceased borrower's loan may be assumed by an individual not liable for the indebtedness in accordance with subpart I of this part.
The Agency will not continue a loan for any subsequent transfer of title by the heirs, or sale of interests between heirs to consolidate title; and
The Agency treats any subsequent transfer of title as a sale subject to requirements listed in subpart I of this part.

contents.SUBJECT: Agency exception authority.
contents.P: On an individual case basis, the Agency may consider granting an exception to any regulatory requirement or policy of this part if:

P.text: The exception is not inconsistent with the authorizing statute or other applicable law; and

The Agency's financial interest would be adversely affected by acting in accordance with published regulations or policies and granting the exception would resolve or eliminate the adverse effect upon the Agency's financial interest.
